meanings.definition: To cause tension or stress between different groups or individuals.
meanings.sent1: The argument about the project deadline started to interstrain the team members.
meanings.sent2: The political debate interstrained the relationship between the two parties.
meanings.sent3: The interstrain over who gets the last cookie became a funny story later.
meanings.sent4: The interstrain between the rival teams was palpable in the air.
meanings.sent5: The interstrain in the office was so thick you could cut it with a knife.

meanings.definition: To interact or communicate with others in a strained or tense manner.
meanings.sent1: She tried to interstrain with her classmates after the argument.
meanings.sent2: The awkward silence interstrained the conversation between them.
meanings.sent3: Their attempt to interstrain during the meeting ended in laughter.
meanings.sent4: The tension in the room interstrained their ability to communicate effectively.
meanings.sent5: The strained smile on his face only served to interstrain the situation further.
